channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: BI to digitize port arrival records
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: Bureau of Immigration frontliners assigned at the different international airports and seaports are preparing to implement paperless digital arrival cards and records for more effective passenger monitoring, amid the continuing outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Duterte transfers SAP distribution to AFP, PNP
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: The Duterte administration will no longer download aid funds to local government units and will instead tap state security forces to distribute the second tranche of assistance for sectors sidelined by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Galvez: No room to quarantine 42,000 OFWs
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: With around 42,000 overseas Filipino workers returning home in the next two months, the government has expressed concern over how to accommodate the OFWs for the mandatory 14-day quarantine intended to curb the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19.

item.title: Government to enforce localized lockdown
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government may limit lockdowns to barangays or villages with coronavirus cases instead of resorting to widespread community quarantines, to minimize the impact of the pandemic on the economy.

item.title: Go seeks upgrade of health units
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go filed a bill seeking to further capacitate national and local health units to conduct better contact tracing, testing, diagnosis, treatment and surveillance of various diseases.

item.title: Use of rapid test kits defended
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Presidential Adviser on Entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion yesterday defended the use of rapid test kits to detect coronavirus disease 2019 for employees, even as medical groups expressed opposition to its use as clearance to go back to work.

item.title: DOH: Test kits sufficient
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) yesterday assured the public that the country has sufficient supply of test kits to check people suspected of having the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: Lockdown extension will result in closure of businesses — ECOP
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: The Employers Confederation of the Philippines warned that further extension of lockdown measures to contain the coronavirus disease 2019 could lead to more shuttered businesses.

item.title: DILG: Civil society groups behind Cha-cha campaign
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Department of the Interior and Local Government spokesman Jonathan Malaya clarified that the signature campaign for amendments to the 1987 Constitution is ongoing even during the coronavirus disease 2019 outbreak, but insisted the DILG is not involved in the effort by civil society organizations.

item.title: Teen held over ‘threat’ vs Duterte
item.author: Raymund Catindig
item.description: Authorities held a 19-year-old netizen who offered P200 million for the head of President Duterte in Barangay Abar 2, San Jose City, Nueva Ecija last Tuesday.
